meanings.definition: The position or office of a director.
meanings.sent1: She was proud to hold multiple directorships in different companies.
meanings.sent2: The directorships of the board members were crucial for the company's success.
meanings.sent3: Having so many directorships must make her feel like a leader of leaders.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, directorships are like the captains of a ship.
meanings.sent5: The responsibilities of directorships weigh heavily on those in charge.

meanings.definition: The function or skill of directing.
meanings.sent1: His strong directorships were evident in the way he led the team.
meanings.sent2: Effective directorships require clear communication and decision-making.
meanings.sent3: She honed her directorships by organizing school plays.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra of life, good directorships can lead to beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: Mastering directorships takes practice and patience.

meanings.definition: The collective body of directors of a company.
meanings.sent1: The directorships met to discuss the company's future plans.
meanings.sent2: The directorships were in agreement about the new project.
meanings.sent3: The directorships of the company always seemed to be in a rush.
meanings.sent4: The directorships worked together like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The success of the company depended on the unity of the directorships.
